text:

[Swooshipedia frontend/] <https://bitbucket.org/uncorkedstudios/swooshipedia-frontend/commits/e12c37eb01c407270f306014777ea8e6bf7a2846|e12c37eb01c4>: Updated home animations.
 - Gaston Figueroa
[Swooshipedia frontend/] <https://bitbucket.org/uncorkedstudios/swooshipedia-frontend/commits/a2948cc54dfc84e270cdc193445419cd24a093d1|a2948cc54dfc>: Markup Cleanup.
 - Gaston Figueroa
[Swooshipedia frontend/] <https://bitbucket.org/uncorkedstudios/swooshipedia-frontend/commits/1903f378cd2aa2cf1c1d81bfe26a10784fd80ede|1903f378cd2a>: Made paragraphs 16/18 on CS across sizes.
 - Gaston Figueroa
[Swooshipedia frontend/] <https://bitbucket.org/uncorkedstudios/swooshipedia-frontend/commits/d9b6d10e81805d926b999e4c9cb1d07241fe0a0b|d9b6d10e8180>: Improved landing page's desktop prev/next functionality.
 - Gaston Figueroa
[Swooshipedia frontend/] <https://bitbucket.org/uncorkedstudios/swooshipedia-frontend/commits/1164771a90e0f86105aeaa770aaeae7d5b86dd61|1164771a90e0>: Updated CS intro titles with static font-size.
 - Gaston Figueroa
[Swooshipedia frontend/] <https://bitbucket.org/uncorkedstudios/swooshipedia-frontend/commits/baee78cac254349515724ddf8282ed3e8e7fbd76|baee78cac254>: Merge conflict.
 - Gaston Figueroa
<http://swish.uncorkedstudios.com|swish.uncorkedstudios.com> has been updated with the latest and greatest
do we need new builds of the IPA?
Not sure what the plan is. I think we're still waiting for the client for confirmation. <@U026AP8CM> ?
scott and i did some last night, but i'm happy to pack up new ones with these changes
I don't think it would hurt.

I will send client new build when ready. We have completed Engin's open trello cards. Build goes to Nike for them to do QA today and tomorrow. Engin to compile feedback. If there are bugs to fix at that point we will give engin an estimate on how long to fix those potential bugs. Hope this helps. Let me know if you have any questions at all. Happy to chat through anything.
<@U026PHQ3J>: let's pack up builds with these changes from last night if not already in process. I'm on my way to the office. See you all soon
Didn't see all of the messages first. New builds please! I will send to client.
<!channel>:  Got the light zip and the new IPA is uploading now - will update everyone on large
large is uploading to s3 right now - you'll get the email in a momnet
i figured! Thanks <@U0289USNA>
Got it. This factory is go! <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KPXEQtU-VX8&feature=kp>

attachments.title: Soul Coughing - Bus To Beelzebub
attachments.fallback: YouTube Video: Soul Coughing - Bus To Beelzebub

text: <@U026PHQ3J>:  and <@U026AP8CM>  - I'm looking into the 404 error on swooshipedia that nike is seeing.
<@U026AP8CM> <@U0289USNA> Both new IPA's are on Dropbox now
thank you, <@U026PHQ3J> and <@U0289USNA>
My guess is actually that updated assets aren't getting recognized or "added" to the svn
<@U026AP8CM>:  and <@U026PHQ3J>  - I should have a fix for nike's 404 problem

frickin SVN - doing an 'svn add *' will not recursively look inside already tracked subdirectories for new files.  it will only catch updated files.   So at somepoint karen uploaded all new teaser images and none of them were getting added as new files in known directories where being ignored.  dumb.
wow

i've changed my 'add command' to the svn repo and it's been adding new files for a few minutes now...   Nike's SVN is super super slow so I'd guess maybe in 20 minutes we can tell Nike to deploy again and they will see everything looking good.
svn st | grep ^? | sed 's/?    //' | xargs svn add
^---  what the hell kind of command is that...  so glad we gave up SVN years ago.  i :heart:  git
<@U026AP8CM>:  svn is "transmitting data ... " to nike.   will let you know when it's done so you can tell them to re-deploy
<@U026PHQ3J>: sounds good
<@U0289USNA>: i mean.
:thumbsup::thumbsup:
tell Engin?
no
Its still "transmitting data ..."
sorry, thumbs up were confusing.
still transmitting?
yes
does svn stand for something?
still transmitting?
let me know here when it's complete, and i will let engin know.
<@U026AP8CM>: transmission completed - nike should redeploy and verify
would now be a good time to pass along the recent builds as well
I would do so - I dont see why not
ok
That was an epic waste of time.... it was mostly watching the word cup and trying to be polite to the engin ladies...
Holy cow, I am so sorry, Scott!
dont tell them I said that.
lol
Of course not.
Ha
we were only able to test the lite ipad version and it was an old version at that.
that's what i thought!
i could be wrong though.
it wasn't that old though it was like yesterdays build
oh
this sounds like a giant nightmare.
they couldn't get the website depolyed for us to test
Was about to ask if there were any bugs that need my help. Working on some Trapit tasks but can jump in at any time.
it would take like an hour and then spit out a maven :scream: failure error
the poster frames when offline on the ipad lite was the only bug

gaston: and evans  - I think i'm looking to you two for further ideas of how to hack poster frames when the vimeo iframe fails to load.   My solve should have clearly worked and I thought it was, but at the moment it's not so I dont know that to think of that other than to say what I did was a clear hack and maybe we should look for a different solve rather than trying to debug/bandage my solve
<@U0289USNA> How about something similar to the idea of lazyloading videos. If the video exists show it, if not show the poster frame?
It feels like a hack too, though.
<@U0289USNA> How did you test offline videos? I need to be online so I can get data from the API. Is there a way to test without making a build every time?
I download the .zip file and run it locally out of file://   - at which point you can turn of your wifi and have at it.
you can download this morning's lite zip here: <http://s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/ucs-swish/swish-lite-2014-07-09_1636.zip>
Got it
<@U0289USNA> Have you looked into inavigator.onLine? <https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Online_and_offline_events>

attachments.title: Online and offline events
attachments.text: Some browsers implement Online/Offline events from the WHATWG Web Applications 1.0 specification.
attachments.fallback: Mozilla Developer Network: Online and offline events

text: This seems to work great. I noticed you added a 2s delay when testing for ga.answer. Is that just in case the device goes offline briefly and then re-connects?
Wow gaston - I never new that event existed...  that is super helpful and exactly what we need.
the 2s delay is because google analytics is loaded asynchronously and thus not loaded at the time of document.ready
Got it. Will make the change and will test on other browsers.
the main place of concern to test is bundled up in the native app.  I can test that part this evening.
True. That would be great. Thanks.
